headline.main: FIFA Presidential Vote Goes to Second Round
headline.print_headline: FIFA Presidential Vote Goes to Second Round

docs.snippet: Voting in the election to lead football's world governing body FIFA will go to a second round after neither incumbent President Sepp Blatter nor Jordanian challenger Prince Ali bin Al Hussein got two thirds of the vote on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Voting in the election to lead football's world governing body FIFA will go to a second round after neither incumbent President Sepp Blatter nor Jordanian challenger Prince Ali bin Al Hussein got two thirds of the vote on Friday.

headline.main: Connecticut Teen Pleads Not Guilty to Fatal Stabbing Over Coffee
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Teen Pleads Not Guilty to Fatal Stabbing Over Coffee

docs.snippet: A 15-year-old Connecticut boy accused of fatally stabbing a 52-year-old Guatemalan man with a pocket knife over a spilled cup of coffee in front of a McDonald's restaurant has pleaded not guilty to murder charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 15-year-old Connecticut boy accused of fatally stabbing a 52-year-old Guatemalan man with a pocket knife over a spilled cup of coffee in front of a McDonald's restaurant has pleaded not guilty to murder charges.

headline.main: Bill Clinton: Foundation Remains a Nonpartisan Charity
headline.print_headline: Bill Clinton: Foundation Remains a Nonpartisan Charity

docs.snippet: Former President Bill Clinton is defending the work of his global foundation, telling donors it remains a nonpartisan philanthropy and likening recent critiques of the charity to political attacks....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Bill Clinton is defending the work of his global foundation, telling donors it remains a nonpartisan philanthropy and likening recent critiques of the charity to political attacks.

headline.main: 3rd Navy Sailor Guilty in Case of Women Recorded in Showers
headline.print_headline: 3rd Navy Sailor Guilty in Case of Women Recorded in Showers

docs.snippet: A submarine sailor was sentenced Friday to 15 days in a Navy brig after he pleaded guilty to failing to alert superiors when fellow crew member showed him videos of female trainees undressing for showers....
docs.lead_paragraph: A submarine sailor was sentenced Friday to 15 days in a Navy brig after he pleaded guilty to failing to alert superiors when fellow crew member showed him videos of female trainees undressing for showers.

headline.main: David Miliband Says World Refugee Crisis to Worsen With Climate Change
headline.print_headline: David Miliband Says World Refugee Crisis to Worsen With Climate Change

docs.snippet: A historic 52 million people are fleeing conflict worldwide, a trend that will intensify over the next two decades because of climate change, International Rescue Committee chief David Miliband said on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A historic 52 million people are fleeing conflict worldwide, a trend that will intensify over the next two decades because of climate change, International Rescue Committee chief David Miliband said on Friday.

headline.main: For O'Malley, a Lot Riding on Iowa in 2016 Campaign
headline.print_headline: For O'Malley, a Lot Riding on Iowa in 2016 Campaign

docs.snippet: Martin O'Malley is returning to the state that introduced him to presidential politics three decades ago, when he played guitar and knocked on doors for Gary Hart. This time he'll be tooting his own horn, so to speak, in a setting that could deter...
docs.lead_paragraph: Martin O'Malley is returning to the state that introduced him to presidential politics three decades ago, when he played guitar and knocked on doors for Gary Hart. This time he'll be tooting his own horn, so to speak, in a setting that could determine whether his longshot challenge to Hillary Rodham Clinton for the Democratic nomination takes root or fades away.

headline.main: Top-Ranking Mormon Leader Heads to Hospice as Cancer Worsens
headline.print_headline: Top-Ranking Mormon Leader Heads to Hospice as Cancer Worsens

docs.lead_paragraph: A top-ranking Mormon leader, 92-year-old L. Tom Perry, is headed to hospice as his cancer spreads aggressively.

headline.main: Man Convicted in 1992 Ax Murder Charged in Fatal Arson
headline.print_headline: Man Convicted in 1992 Ax Murder Charged in Fatal Arson

docs.snippet: A man who spent 15 years in prison for killing his roommate with an ax caused a fatal fire at a Syracuse boarding house earlier this month by placing a propane tank in an oven, authorities said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man who spent 15 years in prison for killing his roommate with an ax caused a fatal fire at a Syracuse boarding house earlier this month by placing a propane tank in an oven, authorities said.
